SVGAnimatedAngle.summary: The SVGAnimatedAngle interface is used for attributes of basic type <angle> which can be animated.

SVGAnimatedAngleAnimVal.summary: The animVal read-only property of the interface represents the current animated value of the associated <angle> on an SVG element. If the attribute is not currently being animated, animVal will be the same as the baseVal.

remarks.para: This property reflects the animated state of the angle of the animating {{SVGattr("orient")}} attribute of the SVG marker element, providing access to the value of the angle during animations.

SVGAnimatedAngleAnimVal.value: An object representing the animated value of the <angle> content type.

SVGAnimatedAngleBaseVal.summary: The baseVal read-only property of the interface represents the base (non-animated) value of the associated <angle> on an SVG element. This property is used to retrieve the static value of the <angle>, unaffected by any ongoing animations.

remarks.para: This property reflects the <angle> value of the {{SVGattr("orient")}} attribute of the SVG {{SVGElement("marker")}} element, which is the same as the property.

SVGAnimatedAngleBaseVal.value: An object representing the base value of the <angle> content type.
